alert.note: Alert for Graham; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 3:21AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Swain and northwestern Graham Counties through 400 AM EST... At 320 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with gusty winds 13 miles northwest of Robbinsville, or near Smoky Mountains- Twentymile Creek, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Fontana Lake, Fontana Village, Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek, Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome, Smoky Mountains-Oconaluftee, Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain, Smoky Mountains-Deep Creek and Cherokee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
